#Text=Drive a Semi Automatic Car
#Text=Semi-automatic cars are a great way for both new and experienced drivers to learn about shifting gears .
#Text=Unlike manual transmission cars , semi-automatics lack a clutch pedal , making them easier to use .
#Text=To drive , all you need to do is pull the lever when it ’s time to change the car ’s mode or gear .
#Text=This is done by listening to the sound of the car 's engine .
#Text=With a little practice , anyone can learn how to handle a semi-automatic car .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Starting the Car
#Text=Turn the key in the ignition to start the engine .
#Text=Semi-automatic cars typically do n’t require any special treatment to start .
#Text=The parking brake should already be engaged , and you should hold down the brake pedal to ensure the car does n't move forward as you shift it into gear .
#Text=In most semiautomatic cars , the parking brake is engaged when the gearshift is set to " P. "
#Text=Find the gearshift next to you .
#Text=Look down to find the gearshift in the center of the car .
#Text=You ’ll see a stick labeled with a few letters and symbols .
#Text=This is what you use to change gears .
#Text=The symbols will also light up on the dashboard to remind you of what mode the car is in .
#Text=Some cars have steering wheel paddles used to shift gears .
#Text=Look for a + paddle on the right and a - paddle on the left .
#Text=Move the gearshift back if you need to go in reverse .
#Text=The “ R ” on or near the gearshift stands for reverse .
#Text=Hold down the brake and pull the lever towards the R. Release the brake and the car will begin to back up .
#Text=Put the car into drive to engage the gears .
#Text=Pull the gearshift down to the letter “ D , ” which stands for drive .
#Text=The car will start going forward as soon as you let go of the brake .
#Text=You ’ll start out in 1st gear .
#Text=When shifting , you ’ll move the lever past “ N , ” which stands for neutral .
#Text=This is n’t a gear and is rarely used because it cuts the engine off from the accelerator .
#Text=Move the gearshift over to manual transmission .
#Text=Depending on the car , you ’ll also see an “ M ” or a spot to shift the lever between a + and - sign .
#Text=This is how you control the gears manually .
#Text=Move the lever down and over , but do n’t shift gears yet .
#Text=Begin driving forward before shifting gears .
#Text=Let go of the brake , allowing the car to go forward and pick up speed .
#Text=Listen to the engine and the way the car feels as you drive it .
#Text=As you begin driving , the car will be in 1st gear , but you ’ll need to shift gears as it picks up speed .
#Text=Changing Gears and Parking
#Text=Push up on the gearshift to increase the gear .
#Text=Move the gearshift towards the + sign to go up one gear .
#Text=You should do this anytime the engine sounds like it ’s working too hard , making a high-pitched revving sound .
#Text=The more you drive the car , the easier it ’ll be for you to recognize this sound .
#Text=Some cars may also have a + paddle on the right side of the steering wheel you can pull back on to increase the gear .
#Text=One rule of thumb for shifting gears is to change every .
#Text=For example , switch to 2nd gear when you ’re driving between .
#Text=If your car has a tachometer , shift gears whenever it reaches 3,000 RPM .
#Text=Let go of the gas pedal before downshifting .
#Text=Whenever you ’re slowing down and need to decrease the gear , ease off the gas pedal .
#Text=This will get your car to the proper speed , leading to a safe and seamless transition to the lower gear .
#Text=You do n’t have to let off the gas when shifting up a gear .
#Text=Pull back on the gearshift to lower the gear .
#Text=Move the gearshift towards the - sign , which is always towards you .
#Text=This is done gradually as you decrease speed , and you should never immediately brake if you can avoid it .
#Text=You ’ll hear the engine slow and begin to sputter .
#Text=Remember to watch the speed and RPM indicators .
#Text=For example , shift back to 1st gear when you fall back to or 1,000 RPMs .
#Text=If your car has gear paddles on the wheel , look on the left side for the - paddle .
#Text=Pull it towards you to downshift .
#Text=Bring the car to a stop before putting it in neutral .
#Text=Press the brake to slow the car , downshifting until you reach 1st gear .
#Text=Once the car has come to a complete stop , it is safe to shift into neutral .
#Text=Move the gearshift towards the “ N ” .
#Text=If your car has wheel paddles , pull back on both the + and - paddles to put the car into neutral .
#Text=Engage the parking brake before turning off the car .
#Text=Grasp the gearshift and move it next to the letter P. This turns on the brake .
#Text=Turn off the engine by turning the key in the ignition .
#Text=Now it ’s safe to exit the car .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Semi-automatic driving takes practice , so do n’t worry about not being sure when to shift gears at first .
#Text=Quick Summary
